alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 8:29PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern New Castle, northern Kent and southwestern Cumberland Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 829 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Smyrna, or 9 miles northwest of Dover, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dover, Millville, Bridgeton, Smyrna, Camden, Clayton, Cheswold, Greenwich, Newport, Woodland Beach, Dover Base Housing, Dover Speedway, Fortesque, Green Spring, Fairton, Cedarville, Dividing Creek, Rising Sun-Lebanon, Townsend and Kenton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
